title: Authors and Citation
text: Gregory Jefferis. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jefferis G (2022). malecns: Access latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets. https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns, https://flyconnectome.github.io/malecns/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets},   author = {Gregory Jefferis},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns, https://flyconnectome.github.io/malecns/}, }

what: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: goal malecns provide natverse access whole male central nervous system dataset Janelia FlyEM.

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
code: install.packages("natmanager") natmanager::check_pat() natmanager::install(pkgs="flyconnectome/malecns")  usethis::edit_r_profile() # paste in this text, appropriately edited, and close the file options(malevnc.dvid_user="myuser@gmail.com") options(malevnc.dvid_user="<surname><firstinitial>")  # will open your browser # collect token by clicking on your account icon top right and then Account browseURL('https://neuprint-cns.janelia.org') # back in R usethis::edit_r_environ() # paste in this text replacing with your neuprint token # make sure you have a new lined at the end of the file neuprint_token="eyJhbGci..."  # check everything's configured ok dr_malecns()  # get some data pnmeta=mcns_neuprint_meta('/.+_[adl]+PN') table(pnmeta$type) vm6=read_mcns_meshes('VM6_adPN') plot3d(malecns.surf, alpha=.1)

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: malecns presently thin wrapper around malevnc package. due course hope separate generic functionality malevnc package. However, current arrangement means configuration using malecns package handled malevnc package.

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: package points private resources made available male CNS project led FlyEM team Janelia. therefore need appropriate authorisation install package github access data. can install released version malecns GitHub Note must given access github repository GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) set order install library long remains private. : check follow instructions necessary create. run errors (significant changes github recently), can also try:
code: install.packages("natmanager") natmanager::install(pkgs="flyconnectome/malecns") natmanager::check_pat() usethis::create_github_token()

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: Access neuprint / Clio depends authentication. neuprint, please see https://github.com/natverse/neuprintr#authentication; need set neuprint_token R environment variable. can display neuprint token logging neuprint website. Clio, prompted authenticate via Google OAuth “dance” web browser. Note Clio neuprint tokens look similar, . neuprint token appears indefinite clio token currently lasts 3 weeks.

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: interaction Clio/DVID annotation systems may need tell R+malecns emails used sign Clio/neuprint. set .Rprofile file.
code: options(malevnc.dvid_user="myuser@gmail.com") options(malevnc.dvid_user="<surname><firstinitial>")

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: example shows read meshes, look ids position transform positions FlyWire/FAFB14.
code: library(malecns) ## read meshes for some annotated neurons  gs="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/13e2yboGmSHrkdew0REkqXWrx5PfHrwPbZZArySjIHtA/edit?usp=sharing" mca=googlesheets4::read_sheet(gs) # update bodyids based on XYZ position mca$position=mcns_xyz2bodyid(mca$position)  confirmed_neurondf=subset(mca, !is.na(ontology)) ml=read_mcns_meshes(confirmed_neurondf) plot3d(ml, col=symbol)  library(natverse) library(fafbseg) # transform a point in FlyWire voxel space to malecns voxel space # and put it on the clipbaord ready to paste into neuroglancer clipr::write_clip(xform_brain(cbind(109953, 50450, 1660)*c(4,4,40),    reference = 'malecns',   sample = 'FlyWire')/8)

what: Situation report on your malecns package installation — dr_malecns
title: Situation report on your malecns package installation — dr_malecns
text: Situation report malecns package installation

title: Situation report on your malecns package installation — dr_malecns
code: dr_malecns()

what: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
text: Provides access latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets providing thin wrapper around 'malevnc' package.

title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
text: malecns.dataset used keep track active   dataset. present expert use recommended   change manually.

title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
text: Philipp Schlegel made bridging   registrations using bigwarp presynapse predictions male   half brain male cns. See   slack   details.

title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
text: Maintainer: Gregory Jefferis jefferis@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
code: # \donttest{ options()[grepl("^malecns", names(options()))] #> $malecns.dataset #> [1] "CNS" #>  # } if (FALSE) { dr_malecns() }  # \donttest{ library(nat.templatebrains) xform_brain(cbind(443344, 225172, 44920), sample = 'FAFB14',   reference = 'malecns') #>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #> [1,] 302807.7 215023.5 117948.1  mcflm=system.file("landmarks/maleCNS_brain_FAFB_landmarks_um.csv", package = 'malecns') mcflm=read.csv(mcflm) head(mcflm) #>   X   fafb_x    fafb_y    fafb_z    cns_x     cns_y    cns_z #> 1 0 522.3291 183.04947  95.20722 388.0265 161.15978 167.5336 #> 2 1 454.3915  88.80129  95.36000 316.4307  61.91385 170.2850 #> 3 2 597.4928  98.03833  83.20296 448.9167  60.41804 171.1397 #> 4 3 520.0082 210.97573 125.01538 386.9356 193.88847 208.3717 #> 5 4 414.5413 169.81426 155.26571 274.9307 152.79578 222.6996 #> 6 5 645.5330 176.75863 134.32295 501.8497 141.52257 219.8995 if (FALSE) { library(nat.jrcbrains) da1.hb=neuprintr::neuprint_read_neurons('/DA1.*lPN',   conn=neuprintr::neuprint_login(server='https://neuprint.janelia.org',     dataset = 'hemibrain:v1.2.1')) # nb hemibrain neurons comes in 8nm raw voxel coordinates not microns da1.hb.mcns=xform_brain(da1.hb*(8/1000), sample='JRCFIB2018F', reference='malecns') # read in a male cns DA1 neuron da1.1=read_mcns_meshes(11996, units='nm') nclear3d() plot3d(da1.hb.mcns, col='cyan') plot3d(da1.1, col='red') plot3d(malecns.surf, alpha=.1) } # }

what: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
title: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
text: malecns_shell.surf surface model cortex   (rind) malecns brain (nm). downloaded link provided   Stuart Berg (FlyEM). malecns.surf surface model malecns neuropil   generated Philipp Schlegel May 2022 based location T bars   dataset. See   slack   details. JRCFIB2022M.surf malecns.surf aliases

title: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
code: malecns_shell.surf  malecns.surf  JRCFIB2022M.surf

title: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
text: object class hxsurf (inherits list) length 4. object class hxsurf (inherits list) length 4. object class hxsurf (inherits list) length 4.

title: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
code: # \donttest{ library(nat) boundingbox(malecns_shell.surf) #>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #> [1,]  16898.1  31849.1  26324.4 #> [2,] 750590.0 441841.0 460357.0 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "boundingbox" # } if (FALSE) { plot3d(malecns_shell.surf, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in microns plot3d(malecns_shell.surf/1e3, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in raw voxels plot3d(malecns_shell.surf*(8/1e3), alpha=.2, col='grey') # mesh3d gives more flexibility plot3d(as.mesh3d(malecns_shell.surf), alpha=.2, col='grey', type='wire', add=T) } # \donttest{ library(nat) boundingbox(malecns.surf) #>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #> [1,]  45319.4  38146.7  79817.4 #> [2,] 726917.9 417784.6 341814.2 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "boundingbox" # } if (FALSE) { plot3d(malecns.surf, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in microns plot3d(malecns.surf/1e3, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in raw voxels plot3d(malecns.surf*(8/1e3), alpha=.2, col='grey') # mesh3d gives more flexibility plot3d(as.mesh3d(malecns.surf), alpha=.2, col='grey', type='wire', add=T) }

what: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
text: Connectivity query CNS neurons

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
code: mcns_connection_table(   ids,   partners = c("inputs", "outputs"),   moredetails = TRUE,   summary = FALSE,   conn = mcns_neuprint(),   ... )

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
text: ids set body ids (see manc_ids range ways specify ). partners Either inputs outputs. Redundant prepost, probably clearer. moredetails yet implemented summary Whether summarise results per partner giving multiple query neurons conn Optional, neuprint_connection object, also specifies neuPrint server. Defaults manc_neuprint() ensure query VNC dataset. ... additional arguments passed neuprint_connection_table

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
text: data.frame

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
code: # \donttest{ joffrey.id=mcns_xyz2bodyid(cbind(24590, 13816, 26102)+4096, node = 'neuprint') joffrey.ds=mcns_connection_table(joffrey.id, partners = 'in') joffrey.dss=mcns_connection_table(joffrey.id, partners = 'in', summary=TRUE) # } if (FALSE) { # open top 10 partners in neuroglancer, # NB segmentation / meshes to match neuprint mcns_scene(joffrey.dss$partner[1:10], open = TRUE, node='neuprint') }

what: Return all DVID body annotations — mcns_dvid_annotations
title: Return all DVID body annotations — mcns_dvid_annotations
text: Return DVID body annotations

title: Return all DVID body annotations — mcns_dvid_annotations
code: mcns_dvid_annotations(   ids = NULL,   node = "neutu",   rval = c("data.frame", "list"),   cache = FALSE )

title: Return all DVID body annotations — mcns_dvid_annotations
text: ids set body ids form understandable manc_ids node DVID node returned manc_dvid_node. default return current active (unlocked) node used neutu. rval Whether return fully parsed data.frame (default) R list. data.frame easier work typically includes NAs many values missing list. cache Whether cache result call 5 minutes.

title: Return all DVID body annotations — mcns_dvid_annotations
text: tibble containing columns including bodyid numeric value status user naming_user instance status_user comment NB one bodyid used regardless whether key-value   returned 0, 1 2 bodyid fields. ids specified,   missing ids row containing bodyid question   columns NA.

title: Return all DVID body annotations — mcns_dvid_annotations
text: See      Slack post Stuart Berg details. Note original api call <rootuuid>:master,   now just changed <neutu-uuid> returned   manc_dvid_node. range query stopped   working 16 May 2021, probably bad node.

title: Return all DVID body annotations — mcns_dvid_annotations
code: # \donttest{ mda=mcns_dvid_annotations() head(mda) #> # A tibble: 6 × 14 #>       bodyid instance status user  statu…¹ insta…² last_…³ type  halfb…⁴ namin…⁵ #>        <dbl> <chr>    <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   #> 1     100000 (L5_L)   Anchor umay… takemu… takemu… takemu… NA    NA      NA      #> 2     100001 Dm3a_R   Anchor take… NA      takemu… takemu… Dm3a   3.74e9 takemu… #> 3     100003 NA       Anchor umay… NA      NA      NA      NA    NA      NA      #> 4 1000034462 NA       0.5as… umay… NA      NA      NA      NA    NA      NA      #> 5     100004 T4b_R    Anchor take… NA      takemu… takemu… T4b    6.78e9 takemu… #> 6     100005 TmY18_R  Anchor take… NA      NA      NA      TmY18  5.44e9 takemu… #> # … with 4 more variables: class <chr>, group <chr>, group_user <chr>, #> #   type_user <chr>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​status_user, #> #   ²​instance_user, ³​last_modified_by, ⁴​halfbrain_body, ⁵​`naming user` plot(table(mda$type), ylab='Frequency')   kcs=mcns_dvid_annotations("/KC.*") mbons=mcns_dvid_annotations("/MBON.+")  head(mbons) #> # A tibble: 6 × 14 #>   bodyid instance     status user  statu…¹ insta…² last_…³ type  halfb…⁴ namin…⁵ #>    <dbl> <chr>        <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   #> 1 520151 MBON01_L     Anchor umay… NA      lif     lif     MBON…      NA NA      #> 2  10013 MBON01(y5B'… Anchor umay… NA      lif     lif     MBON…      NA NA      #> 3 522749 MBON02_R     Anchor umay… NA      lif     lif     MBON…      NA NA      #> 4 522444 MBON02_L     Anchor umay… NA      lif     lif     MBON…      NA NA      #> 5 519373 MBON03_L     Anchor umay… NA      lif     lif     MBON…      NA NA      #> 6 530875 MBON04_L     Anchor umay… NA      lif     lif     MBON…      NA NA      #> # what: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: Login male CNS neuprint server

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
code: mcns_neuprint(token = Sys.getenv("neuprint_token"), Force = FALSE, ...)

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: token Optional neuprint access token (see details examples trouble multiple tokens). Force Whether force new login CATMAID server (default FALSE) ... Additional arguments passed neuprint_login

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: neuprint_connection object returned  neuprint_login

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: possible use token across public   private neuprint servers using email address. However   seem work users. giving , try   using recently issued token private server (e.g. cns   dataset) rather older tokens e.g. hemibrain dataset. need   pass specific token can use token argument, also   setting Force=T ensure specified token used   already tried log current session. See examples   code.

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
code: if (FALSE) { cnsc=mcns_neuprint()  # log in using specified token rather than the one in the neuprint_token # environment variable. This should then be cached for the rest of the R # session. cnsc=mcns_neuprint(token="XXX", Force=T)  anchorids <- neuprintr::neuprint_ids("status:Anchor", conn=cnsc) # the last connection will be used by default anchormeta <- neuprintr::neuprint_get_meta("status:Anchor")  plot(cumsum(sort(anchormeta$pre, decreasing = TRUE)), ylab='Cumulative presynapses') plot(cumsum(sort(anchormeta$post, decreasing = TRUE)), ylab='Cumulative postsynapses') }

what: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta
title: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta
text: Fetch neuprint metadata malecns neurons

title: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta
code: mcns_neuprint_meta(ids = NULL, conn = mcns_neuprint(), roiInfo = FALSE)

title: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta
text: ids body ids. conn Optional, neuprint_connection object, also specifies neuPrint server. Defaults manc_neuprint() ensure query VNC dataset. roiInfo whether include roiInfo field detailing synapse numbers different locations. omitted default returned character vector unprocessed JSON.

title: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta
text: data.frame one row (unique) id NAs   columns except bodyid neuprint holds metadata.

title: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta
text: contrast malevnc::manc_neuprint_meta leave   bodyis numeric (doubles) since flyem now guarantee less   2^53 ie within range doubles can exactly represent numeric   ids.

title: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta

what: Construct a neuroglancer scene for CNS dataset — mcns_scene
title: Construct a neuroglancer scene for CNS dataset — mcns_scene
text: Construct neuroglancer scene CNS dataset

title: Construct a neuroglancer scene for CNS dataset — mcns_scene
code: mcns_scene(   ids = NULL,   open = FALSE,   dataset = getOption("malecns.dataset"),   node = "neutu" )

title: Construct a neuroglancer scene for CNS dataset — mcns_scene
text: ids set bodyids open Whether open default browser dataset Optional CNS dataset node Optional node specifier e.g. "neutu", "neuprint". default use latest neutu node since malecns node specified Clio rarely updated nodes used longer periods compared male vnc.

title: Construct a neuroglancer scene for CNS dataset — mcns_scene
text: character vector containing URL

title: Construct a neuroglancer scene for CNS dataset — mcns_scene
code: if (FALSE) { mcns_scene(4060524874, open=TRUE, node='neuprint')  }

what: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
title: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
text: Set DVID type, instance group malecns neurons

title: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
code: mcns_set_dvid_annotations(   ids,   type = NULL,   group = NULL,   side = NULL,   instance = T,   user = getOption("malevnc.dvid_user"),   ... )

title: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
text: ids Body ids type Character vector specifying cell type e.g. "LHAD1g1" group One LR groups (.e. candidate cell types) apply. normally lowest bodyid group. Must length ids unless length 1. side Character vector specifying side neuron ("L", "R" "" specified) instance Character vector specifying instances (names) neurons (see details) emph logical value TRUE (default) means append side type. user DVID user. Defaults options("malevnc.dvid_user"). ... Additional arguments passed malevnc:::manc_set_dvid_instance thence pbapply::pbmapply multiple body ids.

title: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
text: male CNS, evolving standard seems record   following fields (examples given APL) type='APL' instance='APL_R' group='APL_R' type_user, instance_user, group_user='jefferisg' accompany   . Note type_user, instance_user, group_user set   automatically using user argument. Regrettably   currently specify different users different different fields (e.g. one   user instance different user type).   need (e.g. making annotations behalf users)   need make separate calls   mcns_set_dvid_annotations field need set.

title: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
code: if (FALSE) { mcns_set_dvid_annotations(10297, type = 'LHAD1g1') mcns_set_dvid_annotations(10977, type='APL', side='L', group = 10540) # only set the LR group mcns_set_dvid_annotations(ids=c(13115, 14424), group = 13115)  # unset a type (careful!) mcns_set_dvid_annotations(18987, type = "", user = "becketti") }

text: x objects 3D vertices (calibrated nm) ... Additional arguments passed nat.templatebrains::xform_brain

title: Mirror points in malecns space — mirror_malecns
text: transformed object

title: Mirror points in malecns space — mirror_malecns
text: mirroring course improved. used Philipp   Schlegel's 69 landmarks map malecns -> FAFB space followed   nat.jrcbrains::mirror_fafb function map landmarks   opposite side FAFB brought back malecns.

title: Mirror points in malecns space — mirror_malecns
code: if (FALSE) { f3=system.file("landmarks/maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm.csv", package = 'malecns') maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm <- read.csv(f3)[-1] points3d(mirror_malecns(maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm[1:3])) points3d(maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm[1:3], col='green') # almost on top of the black points points3d(maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm[4:6]+500, col='red') }

what: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
text: Read mesh current segmentation

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
code: read_mcns_meshes(   ids,   units = c("nm", "raw", "microns"),   type = c("auto", "dvid", "small"),   node = "neutu",   df = NULL,   ... )

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
text: ids set body ids form understandable manc_ids units Units returned neurons (default nm) type One "auto" (default), "dvid" "small" (see details). node DVID node returned manc_dvid_node. default return current active (unlocked) node used neutu. df data.frame containing information neurons meshes fetched. Optional ids data.frame, used. ... Additional arguments passed httr::GET

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
text: neuronlist containing one mesh3d objects.

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
text: dvid meshes pre-computed automatically deleted   recomputed boides edited. However process   noticeable lag. small meshes generated demand process   can quite slow. auto try dvid method   switch small fails. See   slack    details; essentially behaviour flyem clio   fork.

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
code: if (FALSE) { ml=read_mcns_meshes(1796013202) plot3d(ml) # or if there's just one mesh, you can get more control with the rgl commands # like wire3d wire3d(ml[[1]]) }

title: Read neuronal skeletons via neuprint — read_mcns_neurons
text: ids Bodyids form compatible malevnc::manc_ids connectors Whether fetch synaptic connections neuron (default FALSE contrast neuprint_read_neurons). units Units returned neurons (default nm) heal.threshold threshold ... Additional arguments passed neuprint_read_neurons

title: Read neuronal skeletons via neuprint — read_mcns_neurons
text: neuronlist object containing one  neuron objects.

title: Read neuronal skeletons via neuprint — read_mcns_neurons
code: # nb convert n30102=read_mcns_neurons(30102) # neuronlist n30102 #> 'neuronlist' containing 1 'neuprintneuron' object and 'data.frame' with 18 vars [148.8 kB] boundingbox(n30102) #>        [,1]   [,2]   [,3] #> [1,] 168448  92160 197632 #> [2,] 275968 169984 273408 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "boundingbox" # neuron n30102[[1]] #> 'neuron' with 1993 vertices in 1 tree and additional classes 'neuprintneuron', 'catmaidneuron' if (FALSE) { nclear3d() plot3d(malecns.surf, alpha=.1) plot3d(n30102, lwd=2, soma=2000) }

what: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
title: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
text: malecns thin wrapper around malevnc   operates changing server/dataset options package.   function temporarily changes options, runs required expression   sets back .

title: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
code: with_mcns(expr, dataset = getOption("malecns.dataset"))  choose_mcns(dataset = getOption("malecns.dataset"))

title: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
text: expr expression evaluate default autosegmentation dataset name dataset reported Clio e.g. CNS, VNC etc

title: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
code: if (FALSE) { with_mcns(malevnc::manc_dvid_node(type = 'clio')) }
